body_content.explanation: If a road, river, etc. is crossable, you are able to cross it from one side to the other:
examples: It will take us an hour to walk to the crossable part of the river.
A crossable gap in traffic is defined as the time needed to cross at walking speed, plus a safety buffer.

body_content.explanation: If a plant or animal is crossable with another of a different type, they can be bred together in order to produce a new variety (= type of plant or animal):
examples: The most crossable wheat varieties originate from Asia.
Species within each gene pool are usually crossable with each other.
